sub_title: ISO / DPO - VP , Mizuho Bank Europe N.V.
summary:
MSc (NL), MSc (DE), BSc Hons (UK), CCSK, CISA, CISM, CRISC, CGEIT, CDPSE, ITIL, ISO 27001 LA, ISO 9001 PA, PCI Awareness, 6K+ connections - Linkedin Open Networker..

An Information Security Professional / Information Systems Auditor with over 6 years experience related to Information Security, IT Risk Management, GRC and BIG 4 Consultancy. Strong academic background and technical work experience in the field of ICT with over 5 years experience related to IT Infrastructure, Software Development and IT Service Delivery. An ambitious individual, driven by determination, enthusiasm and success. Strives to work efficiently, both independently and as a team player. 

I am currently working as Senior Associate Director - ISO & DPO for Amsterdam, Brussels, Madrid and Vienna branch of a Japanese Corporate Bank in Amsterdam. Prior to this I worked in MUFG Bank Europe as Assistant Vice President - IT SOx & Controls Specialist. I have also served a leading role as European Information Security Officer EMEA in Kyocera Document Solutions Europe (Group). Before pursuing my Double Masters in Cyber Security / Information Security and Privacy, I was working as a Senior Information Systems Auditor within KPMG’s Information Risk Management Advisory practice.

I have extensive experience with working on assignments related to GRC. I was responsible for managing the preparation of audit requisite documentation, GITCs, Entity Level Controls, Management Letter and eAudit. My job role included executing & reporting phases of the project. I was also responsible for staff training and development (relating to IRM procedures / documentation and eAudit) and review of their fieldwork and deliverables. 

As part of the leadership team, I helped deliver assurance and advisory services to clients in the areas of information technology, enterprise applications, business process control, IT governance, enterprise risk, information security and regulatory compliance.

I was actively involved with advisory engagements including revenue assurance and branchless banking application reviews. Performed assessment on banking application and its underlying architecture to ensure adequate access controls are in place. Performed Dry Run testing of key controls over critical IT Applications with the objective to confirm controls design effectiveness documented in the Risk and Control Matrix.

Prior to joining KPMG, I was a member of organizations in UK where I had extensive software development and project management experience and worked on information management systems such as ERPs and CRMs.

projects.title: SOX 404 Dry Run Testing Project at Pakistan Mobile Communications Limited (PMCL) - Mobilink
projects.description:
Performed Dry Run testing of key controls over critical IT Applications with the objective to confirm controls design effectiveness by determining that.:

A) Key SOX controls documented in the Risk and Control Matrix (RCM) 
•	have been implemented as described
•	are operated as intended by persons possessing the necessary authority and competence to perform the control effectively
•	are not compromised by ineffective segregation of duties (SoD)
•	satisfy the company's control objectives and can effectively prevent or detect errors or fraud that could result in material misstatements in the financial statements.

B) Non Key controls documented in (RCM) were confirmed through inquiry, observation and examination of implemented controls as documented.

Assessment of previously overlooked or undiscovered internal control deficiencies identified and remediated in advance. Inspection of controls supporting documentation with respect to key controls with a high level of complexity.

profile_positions.description:
● Responsible for implementation of Information Security policies and procedures.
● Responsible for ensuring compliance to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
● Implementation of Role Based Access control via a customized workflow application that involves automation of access provisioning process and managing issues via change requests.
● Developing and implementing controls and processes for continuous monitoring.
● Contribute to risk assessments and remediation action plans as per the risk appetite.
● Participate in vendor due-diligence, assessment of information security risks and conduct Data
Privacy Impact Assessment for new applications.
● Perform review of new IT projects and onboarding of new applications.
● Conduct Information Security Trainings and Awareness activities to raise the level of maturity
among employees to report issues on a day to day basis.
● Managed SWIFT customer security programme (CSP) to prevent and detect fraudulent activities
through a set of mandatory controls and penetration testing activities via consulting firms.
● Coordination with DNB and NBB for TARGET 2 self certification of three branches.
● Liaise with Internal / External Auditors and DNB for Information Security topics and closing audit
findings by providing relevant evidence to open issues.
profile_positions.title: Senior Associate Director - Information Security Officer & Data Protection Officer

profile_positions.description:
• Managing maintenance of the Risk Control Matrix (RCM) and updating control descriptions to reflect accurate representation of processes and procedures in place for Global / Local IT SOx and JSOx Operations based on COBIT standard and COSO framework for financial processes of the Bank.
• Guide key-stakeholders on a broad range of specific technology controls and information security programs, policies, standards, IT risk management activities and self-assessments. 
• Contribute to the definition, development and oversight of Global IT SOx management strategy and framework that includes IT General Controls (User Access / Privileged Management, Change Management, Batch Job Processing, Information Security and System Operations), Automated Controls, End User Computing and Robotic Process Automation (RPA) Reviews.
• Coordinate DNB Regulatory Reporting projects such as the creation of Deposit Guarantee Scheme (DGS) ITGCs and ITACs framework for all data source and processing systems, liaison with auditors for third party ISAE 3402 report.
• Liaise with Internal / External Auditors as a focal point of contact with IT SOx related Audits.
• Provide risk-based guidance and engagement on SOx findings remediation action plan by influencing behaviour to reduce risk and foster a strong technology risk management culture.
• Management Reporting on overall health for timely submission of SOx related audit findings.
• Redesign and implementation of the IT security / risk management measures for SOx & third party reporting ISAE 3402 (SAS70).
• Restructuring of identity and access management process for applications.
• Review of End User Computing controls for spreadsheets, databases and in-house developed business support applications for the bank operations.
profile_positions.title: Assistant Vice President, IT SOx and Controls

profile_positions.description:
• Responsible to establish, maintain, implement, interpret and communicate organisation-wide information systems security policies, standards, and procedures across the EMEA region.
• Working with the business to develop an understanding of the business value and processes around each area and aligning the corporate security strategy and road-map.
• Promoting standardization and alignment with architecture and security frameworks by
maintaining the Information Security Management System - ISO 27001 across 17 countries.
• Responsible for Security Management and Risk Governance with a focus on global systems and international cooperation with Local Information Security Officers in EMEA region.
• Leading the end user security awareness and vigilance training program along with information
security compliance as per the defined policies.
• Support the Data Protection Officer and Legal Team to implement GDPR across the Group.
• Perform Information Security Risk Assessments, Internal Audits and reviews based on policies
and best practices (for both technical and operational aspects).
• Coordinate SOx, IT, Certifications and Information Security Scans with Independent Auditors / Certification Bodies including preparation, sample delivery, onsite facilitation and management response activities.
• Participate in Governance, Risk & Compliance activities with regards to Information Security and Privacy implementation, SOx Compliance, SAP Authorizations, Segregation of Duties Analysis, Change Management, Business Continuity and ITGCs.
• Responsible for vulnerability management and risk remediation across enterprise business
applications for legacy systems and cloud based solutions.
• Defining criterias and assessing information security requirements for new strategic projects
based on policies and privacy requirements.
• Coordinate incident management,response, risk remediation and reporting activities with support from all key stakeholders across technology / business domains.
profile_positions.title: European Information Security Officer - Governance, Risk & Compliance - EMEA

profile_positions.description: Social Engineering in Companies: The Human Risk Factor
profile_positions.title: Masters Thesis Research

profile_positions.description:
•	As part of the leadership team deliver assurance and advisory services to clients in the areas of IT Security and Risk Management, IT in the External Audit, IT Internal Audit, Independent Project Assurance, ERP Process Controls and assurance services including enterprise application risks (SAP & Oracle GRC stack), Revenue Assurance, IT governance, Application Controls and Information Security and Regulatory Compliance.
•	Successfully delivering technology risk services to corporate industry clients via business analysis and understanding of major ERP applications like SAP and Oracle enabled core business processes within corporates lines of business.
•	Planning and scoping of Information Risk Management (IRM) engagements by evaluating IT internal controls and business risks and make appropriate recommendations by addressing Entity Level Controls Program, Financial Reporting Audit Program and General IT Controls. 
•	Advisory engagements including revenue assurance and core banking application reviews.
•	Work within tight timescales, to budget and to a high quality by evaluating operating practices to determine if controls, risk and security measures are adequate against recognised best practices and industry benchmarks as per standards, policies and frameworks e.g. ISO27001, NIST, COBIT, ITIL, TOGAF, MOF, ISO20000 and ISO 22301.
•	Assess dependability of information systems and associated data.
•	Confirm adherence of information systems and associated data.
•	Building and managing excellent client relationships (typically at CIO / project sponsor level). 
•	Compile audit work and prepare working papers for review purposes.
•	Actively identifying and progressing business development opportunities, as well as managing sales activities such as proposal writing and assisting with client presentations.
•	Coaching and developing team members on engagements. Contributing to practice management, e.g. training and knowledge management.
profile_positions.title: Senior Information Systems Auditor - IT Advisory Services

profile_positions.description:
•	Helped multiple clients with hardening web application security, patch management and recovering web sites from hacking attacks. 
•	Responsible for Change Management, Emergency Changes, Incident Management, Problem •	Management and regular backups of web applications. 
•	Performed risk management, vulnerability assessment and regular testing of General IT Controls.
•	Assisted clients to assess, monitor and improve their Information Security and IT Operation functions and build my reputation through quality of work, knowledge and experience.
•	Ensure issues related to the framework for the governance of enterprise IT are reviewed, monitored, reported and remediated.
•	Ensure that organizational structures are in place to enable effective planning and implementation of IT-enabled business investments.
•	Ensure the establishment of a communication channel to reinforce the value of the governance of enterprise IT and transparency of IT costs, benefits and risk throughout the enterprise.
•	Ensure that IT-enabled investments are managed through their economic life cycle to achieve business benefit.
•	Ensure that processes are in place to identify, acquire and maintain IT resources and capabilities (i.e., information, services, infrastructure and applications, and people).
•	Evaluate, direct and monitor sourcing strategies to ensure existing resources are taken into account to optimize IT resource utilization.

Key Client: 
•	EURO PAK CARGO SERVICES LIMITED
profile_positions.title: IT and Information Security Consultant

profile_positions.description:
•	Entrusted with the authority to be in charge of highly pressurised environment (often leading a team of 2-5 people), delegate individual staff to conduct necessary tasks, anticipate potential demand areas and allocate resources accordingly and teamwork with other staff members to achieve 7% increase in monthly sales.
•	Developed good interpersonal and verbal communication skills dealing with customers and staff with a wide range of personalities and backgrounds by maintaining excellent consumer relations.
•	Successfully marketed products through up-selling and extended training from Microsoft, Apple and SONY.
•	Commercial and competitor awareness of the business, adapting practices using customer feedback.
•	Conducted weekly training sessions with Technical Advisors for latest technologies and products knowledge.
•	Promoted to a team leader position as a result of good sales, motivational performance, hard work, ability to be flexible to changing priorities and achieving targets with strict deadlines.
profile_positions.title: Technical Advisor - Team Leader

profile_positions.description:
•	Implementing security authorisation architectures including role based access models, development of roles and policies for user authorization and access controls, security controls and enhanced procedures to maintain the integrity of the security model.
•	Installation and Server Management of Accounting / Financial Management applications.
•	Designed, developed and implemented a distributed cash office payments and receipts management system for UWESU Sports & Activities Centre with advanced reporting features for the finance department.
•	Developed a flexible IT Asset Management System designed to help keep track of assets and IT equipment across all four campuses and manage resources effectively. 
•	Responsible for Change Management, Emergency Changes, Incident Management, Problem Management and escalation handling of all IT services.
•	Modified and implemented new business objects with advanced backup features in applications.
•	Delivered all IT projects within budget and time with a team of 1-3 IT Support assistants.
•	Practices implemented included: Project planning and cost analysis for all IT implementations, formulation of policies and procedures, incorporating helpdesk process and standards, professional development and training of staff, quality assurance procedures for disaster recovery, health and safety and IT training.
•	Promoting events at UWE by sending marketing email campaigns and collecting feedback from online surveys.
•	Procurement of IT equipment and deployment after researching new technologies to enhance performance and coordination with IT Services and Independent Contractors for design, setup and maintenance of computer networks.
•	Responsible for coordinating an exciting web-based project and content management system.
•	Designed and implemented a new user interactive public site where 40,000 students, staff and alumni can manage their membership and find information about student matters.

profile_positions.title: Student Representative

profile_positions.company: University of the West of England
profile_positions.description:
• Facilitated weekly group sessions with students, focusing on active learning.
• Effective time management during the sessions while constructively helping the first years gain knowledge was part of being a PAL leader.
• Helped students build confidence and self esteem.
• Developed good presentation skills by delivering lecture reviews using MS Power Point.
• Encouraging students to ask questions and redirecting questions in class to lead students to a better understanding of the subject and conveying my ideas to students helped me to improve my team working skills.
• Holding interactive discussion groups among the students for exchange of opinions, study techniques, problem solving, lecture reviews and summarising helped me to improve my communication skills and to communicate well with large groups of people.
• Communicating with other PAL leaders and lecturers to plan and prepare for the sessions helped me to develop my organisational skills.
• Helping the students out with their assignment and queries regarding other university matters helped me improve my problem solving abilities.
• Attended various training sessions delivered by professionals such as Kate Firth on voice projection, body language and building rapport.
• Wrote monthly reports on the student performance and attendance.
• Maintained regular contact with the PAL Office and the Academic Staff Contact.
• Gathered student evaluation information for the PAL Office.
• Completed registers, session plans and self-reflection forms on a weekly basis.
• Maintained a professional attitude on issues such as confidentiality, marks, standards and student complaints.
